document.docTitle: Iranotelmatoscopus kenyensis Ježek & Oboňa 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of moth flies (Diptera, Psychodidae, Psychodinae) from the Afrotropical Region

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of moth flies (Diptera, Psychodidae, Psychodinae) from the Afrotropical Region

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Male. Head almost rounded from frontal view (1.1 times as broad as long). Vertex with raised

Thorax. Anepisternum setae patch elliptic, anepimeron with almost circular setose patch ( Fig. 37 ). Spiracles set low on mesothorax, closely separated from anterior region of anepisternite. No thoracic allurement organs. Wings ( Fig. 57 ) lanceolate, 1.6 mm long - holotype , paratypes 1.5–2.0 mm, rounded distally, not expanded at the posterior margin. The ending of R 5 a little beyond the tip of wing. Wing membrane slightly infuscated and ends of all veins are a little strengthened distally with dark spots. R 1 proximally very weakened. Following veins or their parts strengthened: Sc, with conspicuously marked last third; R 2 and R 5 basally; M
3 in
2/3 of the length; CuA
2 in
the middle conspicuously and gradually to basal part with lesser intensity. Radial and medial forks complete, their position see on Fig. 57 . Both forks and the ending of CuA 2 are in one line (central area of wing). Wing indices AB:AC:AD = 3.8:3.8:4.2; BC:CD:BD = 1.0:1.2:2.2. Wing index 2.6, medial wing angle 180° (BCD). Halteres ( Fig. 38 ) almost spatula-shaped with a prolonged stem. Ratio of maximum length of halteres to their maximum width approximately 2.5:1. Ratios of lengths of femora, tibiae and first tarsal segments P 1 2.1:2.5:1.0, P 2 2.5:3.1:1.4, P 3 2.6:3.1:1.3. Paired tarsal claws of P 1 bent distad, with two ventral thickening ( Fig. 50 ).

Female. Head with eyes separated, formed by 3 facet rows and frons 1.5 times wider than facet diameter ( Fig. 41 ). Wings approximately similar to males, paratypes 1.9–2.2 mm long, allotype 1.9. Wing index 3.0. Ratios of lengths of femora, tibiae and first tarsal segments P 1 1.9:2.0:1.0, P 2 2.2:2.9:1.3, P 3 2.2:3.1:1.3. Ovipositor 2.8 times as long as basis ( Fig. 55 ), a little bent, paired cerci with rounded ending and an inner folding membrane ( Fig. 54 ). Subgenital plate ( Figs. 46, 47 , 53 ) V-shaped, bilobed distally with very deep caudal concavity and prolonged basis in a horizontal axis, generally almost elliptic, of which sides are triangular (right angle). Setae are not developed near margins of basal elliptic part in contrast to distal one, which has numerous microsetae. Sensory organ developed, digitate. A trapezoidal tablet inside of genital chamber not developed and lateral inner lobuli are almost oblong-shaped distally. Genital chamber ( Figs. 47, 48 , 53 ) from dorsal view with two pointed stilts proximally.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 34–40.
Iranotelmatoscopus kenyensis Ježek & Oboňa
sp. nov.
male. 34. Head, frontal view. 35. Frons and facets in detail, frontal view. 36. Maxilla and palpus maxillaris. 37. Thoracic sclerites, lateral view. 38. Haltere, lateral view. 39. Gonopod, dorsal view. 40. Aedeagal complex, dorsal view. [Scale: 37 = 0.2 mm; 34–36, 38–40 = 0.1 mm]

FIGURES 41–48.
Iranotelmatoscopus kenyensis Ježek & Oboňa
sp. nov.
male (42–45) and female (41, 46–48). 41. Frons and facets in detail, frontal view. 42. Scape, pedicel and basal flagellomeres. 43. Left terminal lobe of labium. 44. Gonopod, lateral view. 45. Aedeagal complex, lateral view. 46. Subgenital plate, lateral view. 47. Subgenital plate and genital chamber, dorsal view. 48. Genital chamber anteriorly. [Scale: 41–48 = 0.1 mm]

FIGURES 49–55.
Iranotelmatoscopus kenyensis Ježek & Oboňa
sp. nov.
male (49–52) and female (53–55). 49. Cibarium, labrum and epipharynx, diagonal view. 50. Tarsal claw of P 1 , lateral view. 51. Epandrium and epandrial clasping lobes, dorsal view. 52. Epandrium and epandrial clasping lobes, lateral view. 53. Subgenital plate and genital chamber, lateral view. 54. Ovipositor, dorsal view. 55. Same, lateral view. [Scale: 49, 52–55 = 0.1 mm; 50 = 0.05 mm]

subSubSection.paragraph:
On the other hand, males of
I . hajiabadi
have index of distance of tangential points of apices of eyes to facet diameter 7.6, length ratio of maxillary palps 1.0:1.2:1.4:2.1, last segment of maxillary palp annulate, medial wing angle 199.5°, wing index 2.2, sclerotized ribs of ejaculatory apodeme distally in number two, conspicuous flaps on both sides of racquet-shaped aedeagus not developed and single epandrial aperture.

Female characters are: digital sensory organ of subgenital plate not developed in contrast to presence of perforated trapezoidal tablet of subgenital plate, lateral inner lobuli distally tongue-shaped and only one proximal stil of genital chamber from dorsal view.

FIGURES 56–57. 56.
Hemimormia nyangerensis Ježek & Oboňa
sp. nov.
male wing (photo). 57.
Iranotelmatoscopus kenyensis Ježek & Oboňa
sp. nov.
male wing (photo). [Scale: 56, 57 = 1 mm]

subSubSection.paragraph: Type locality. Equatorial Africa: Kenya , Nyangera, Victoria Lake environment.

Etymology. The new species name is the Latinized adjective
kenyensis
( -is, -e ) based on the country of origin.

Bionomics. Unknown. Adults were collected in wetland rushes of margins of the water body with rapidly growing
Cyperus papyrus
L. ( Fig. 58 ).
Distribution. This species is known only from Equatorial Africa—Kenya and Uganda .
